channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Federal judge blocks Trump's plan to target 'alien enemies' for deportation
item.description: Trump invoked the wartime authority Alien Enemies Act, targeting members of Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua for expedited deportation. But a federal judge blocked the action Saturday evening.
item.content:encoded:
Trump invoked the wartime authority Alien Enemies Act, targeting members of Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua for expedited deportation. But a federal judge blocked the action Saturday evening.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Trump orders strikes on Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen and issues new warning
item.description: Trump said the U.S. would use "overwhelming lethal force" until Iranian-backed Houthi rebels cease their attacks on shipping. The Houthis said nine civilians were killed.
item.content:encoded:
Trump said the U.S. would use "overwhelming lethal force" until Iranian-backed Houthi rebels cease their attacks on shipping. The Houthis said nine civilians were killed.

(Image credit: Osamah Abdulrahman)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump Administration say South Africa's Ambassador to U.S. 'persona non grata'
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio says he's kicking out the Ambassador from South Africa -accusing him of hating America and hating Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Secretary of State Marco Rubio says he's kicking out the Ambassador from South Africa -accusing him of hating America and hating Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Cliff Owen)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: 'Bloody Saturday' at Voice of America and other U.S.-funded networks
item.description: Federal officials placed 1,300 employees at Voice of America on indefinite paid leave, while severing contracts with Radio Free Asia and other U.S.-funded networks.
item.content:encoded:
Federal officials placed 1,300 employees at Voice of America on indefinite paid leave, while severing contracts with Radio Free Asia and other U.S.-funded networks.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Israeli strikes in Gaza kill 9, including aid workers and journalists, witnesses say
item.description: Two back-to-back Israeli airstrikes in northern Gaza killed at least nine people on Saturday, according to Gaza civil defense. Witnesses say several of those killed were aid workers and journalists.
item.content:encoded:
Two back-to-back Israeli airstrikes in northern Gaza killed at least nine people on Saturday, according to Gaza civil defense. Witnesses say several of those killed were aid workers and journalists.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Here are 8 photography winners with disabilities who show the world their perspective
item.description: Here are the winning entries in this year's Global Ability Photography Challenge.
item.content:encoded: Here are the winning entries in this year's Global Ability Photography Challenge.
item.dc:creator: Charu Bahri

item.title: 'Sounds like censorship to me.' O cinema co-founder slams proposed eviction over film
item.description: No Other Land has no U.S. distributor, so the filmmakers have had to make one-on-one deals with cinemas. Art house theaters such as O Cinema have been screening the film independently.
item.content:encoded:
No Other Land has no U.S. distributor, so the filmmakers have had to make one-on-one deals with cinemas. Art house theaters such as O Cinema have been screening the film independently.

(Image credit: O Cinema)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Opinion: Monopoly money is going digital
item.description: There's an app for that! NPR's Scott Simon reflects on the news that the classic board game Monopoly will soon come with a banking app — no more paper money, math, or banking duties required.
item.content:encoded:
There's an app for that! NPR's Scott Simon reflects on the news that the classic board game Monopoly will soon come with a banking app — no more paper money, math, or banking duties required.

(Image credit: Rick Bowmer)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: HUD choked funding to enforce fair-housing laws. Legal aid groups may not survive
item.description: Most housing discrimination claims are handled by local nonprofits around the country. They say the Trump administration has hobbled them, and are challenging the cuts as unlawful.
item.content:encoded:
Most housing discrimination claims are handled by local nonprofits around the country. They say the Trump administration has hobbled them, and are challenging the cuts as unlawful.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Why there's always room for dessert, according to brain science
item.description: It doesn't matter how full you are, you can always fit in a bite or two or three of pie and ice cream. Scientists say it has to due with special neurons in our brain that just can't get enough sugar.
item.content:encoded:
It doesn't matter how full you are, you can always fit in a bite or two or three of pie and ice cream. Scientists say it has to due with special neurons in our brain that just can't get enough sugar.

(Image credit: Maren Caruso/Digital Vision)
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong
